poem:
Title: The Bleeding Lotus.

In the shadows of the olive groves,
the ground cries out, desolate food for the hungry,
who gnaw at life's green margin.
Men talk, around silver tongues, travel beats the same echo,
all the while, Gaza's heart splits open,
a lily silenced in the fires of proclamation.
Oh, the hollowness of this world's chime,
under the cold gaze of the indifferent sun.
